definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

pinyin: xiao1 shou4 shi2 dian3 qing2 bao4 xi4 tong3

sentences.english: If you order both red wine and white wine, you should follow the principle of eating fish first then meat.
sentences.chinese: 如果同時點了紅白葡萄酒，應遵循先魚後肉的原則。

sentences.english: The dismantlement appraisal date shall be the date of issuance of license for house dismantlement .
sentences.chinese: 拆遷估價時點一般爲房屋拆遷許可證頒發之日。

sentences.english: At some point, there may be a Chinese Silicon Valley.
sentences.chinese: 在某個時點，或許會出現一個“中國硅谷”。

sentences.english: Please check and confirm the products received on delivery.
sentences.chinese: 請於收貨時點算清楚產品種類及數量。

sentences.english: The self-involvements of subjects influence the accuracy of temporal order and temporal locus memory.
sentences.chinese: 時序和時點的回溯回憶受被試的自我捲入程度的影響。

sentences.english: The Taoist ignited the loess-made yellow paper when offering sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 道士在祭祀時點燃了黃表紙。

sentences.english: The survey was carried out in one Shanghai District Bureau of Public Security.
sentences.chinese: 在上海市某公安分局內進行截斷面時點調查。

sentences.english: She scares me at dinner too, by ordering a salad.
sentences.chinese: 她在晚餐時點沙拉的行爲也着實嚇到我了。

sentences.english: The decision-making problem of item investment timing is a very hot topic presently.
sentences.chinese: 項目投資時點決策問題是投資理論的熱門話題之一。

definition: (of a sum of money etc) receivable
sum (result of addition)/addition/total/to add up a number of items/to accumulate
(Tw) to lower (prices, interest rates etc)/to reduce/to cut
to order goods/to place an order
